content.description: Same far right start (first two bolts) as Indirect Action and 72 Hour Hold. Continue straight up past two more bolts to the anchors
This is the longer, right hand, steep route on the east face. Huecos, side pulls, long reaches thru the steep section. Move left and continue up the face to the anchors.

Very aesthetic rock.  Looks like the work of a sculptor. There is a bolt to the right that appears to be an orphan.  There are some bolts that diagonal up to the left that appear to be a 5.9 variation, mentioned in Mayr's guidebook.
content.location: It's the only 5.7 on the wall and goes up just left of a groove.

content.description: This is the shorter, lefthand route on the steep east face. Climb steep huecos that head out left to a horn at the lip of the roof. Mantle the horn, continue up face to the anchors.

Far right to left traversing line on the Indirect Crag. First bolt found just right of the crack system for

Indirect Action

. Follow traverse up and left as you past 8 nicely and safely placed bolts. As you near the top the traverse piddles out and you top our with a more direct line to chain anchors. Easily lowered with 70m rope. Short ropes, beware as you lower your partner as they are nearly out of sight to your far left and over 5.12 terrain. Â The fifth and sixth bolts shown in the Robbins guidebook apparently do not exist, so there is a runout of somewhat easy (5.6) terrain to the last bolt.
content.location: Far right side of Indirect Crag and right of crack system.
